author: Staff Reporter
text:
Inspector Gopinatha Pandian, who was arrested on the charges of intimidating and waylaying a businessman near Kodai Road toll gate, was placed under suspension on Thursday.

The suspension order was issued to him in the jail, according to police sources. The police were also in search of two other accused in this connection.

Ammayanaickanur police had arrested Gopinatha Pandian and produced him before Judicial Magistrate III M. Seyadhu Sulaiman Ussain at his residence here around 9 p.m. on Tuesday.

Earlier, businessman Siva Perumal of Thathaneri in Madurai, filed a police complaint stating that the Inspector had intercepted his car demanding all documents and bills for the goods he was carrying in his car on January 27. Initially, the Inspector threatened to register a case against him. Later, he collected cash Rs. 1 lakh from Siva Perumal and allowed him to go. On February 12, a three persons in police uniform intercepted Siva Perumal’s car on NH-7 and robbed him of Rs.2.5 lakh and cigarette bundles. They took him and his driver in another car to Nilakottai. The gang fled after leaving them and the car at Nilakottai.

He had filed another complaint with Nilakotti police. The police found that the gang used the car owned by the Inspector.
title: Robbery: Inspector suspended
